image.altText: NSW Police officers scour a property on Fernleigh Close, Windellama after a boy was accidentally shot

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the property in Windellama, near Goulburn, after a firearm was accidentally discharged.Â

title.children: Two charged after boy killed in accidental shooting on rural NSW property

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: Voting in the ACT this federal election? Here's what you should know

image.altText: A man in a jacket looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Canberra Liberals Senate candidate Jacob Vadakkedathu says "there will be voluntary redundancies" as part of a plan to cut public service jobs.

title.children: Canberra Liberals candidate says no forced redundancies in public cuts plan

image.altText: A man with short greying hair in a navy suit and tie stands on a patch of grass looking serious.

props.synopsis: A fortnight after two St Edmund's College students were hit by an alleged stolen car on a median strip outside their school, principal Tim Cleary says "common sense" changes like a 40kph school zone must be made.

title.children: 'Common sense': Principal calls for 40kph zone after boys hit by car

image.altText: Commonwealth park floriade

props.synopsis: The decision-makers behind Canberra's Parliamentary Triangle are sharing their ideas for the future of Commonwealth Park, but they want more input.

title.children: More flowers, a lakeside swimming pool and a Ferris wheel on the cards for Commonwealth Park

image.altText: A man with short black hair sits in a museum in front of a glass artwork depicting cabbage leaves on a wall.

props.synopsis: Blending contemporary artwork with archival material, a new exhibition at the National Museum in Canberra promises to captivate and educate visitors about the little-known history of Aboriginal-Chinese people in Australia.

title.children: New National Museum exhibit 'a celebration' of Aboriginal-Chinese people

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man is sentenced to nearly seven years jail after pleading guilty to five counts of aggravated rape, one act of indecency and a threat to kill committed against a 14-year-old girl over five days.

title.children: Man jailed for raping 14-year-old, threatening to kill her with machete

image.altText: Three primary school kids holding up small whiteboards and smiling

props.synopsis: One in three Australian students are failing to reach proficiency in maths, and according to a new report, many teachers lack the confidence to teach it.Â

title.children: 'Too comfortable with mediocrity': 'Faddish' teaching blamed for maths failures

image.altText: A graphic of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton cut-outs

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese heads to the city of churches while Peter Dutton opts to campaign in his own backyard in Brisbane. Follow live.Â

title.children: Albanese campaigns in Adelaide as Dutton moves to shore up Brisbane

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Plan to help first home buyers won't have 'substantial impact': Chalmers
Lambie mocks Labor, Coalition's housing plan

image.altText: Russia's ambassador to Australia accuses International Criminal Court of bias

props.synopsis: Russia's long-serving ambassador to Australia quietly packs up and returns to Moscow, and there's uncertainty about when his replacement will be approved.

title.children: Russian ambassador leaves Canberra amid uncertainty over replacement

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a news conference.

props.synopsis: In the world of Chinese social media, you don't have to look far to find them â posts encouraging people to join the Russian army are being circulated on accounts with tens of thousands of followers.

title.children: 'Real men are here': The posts luring Chinese men to join Putin's army

image.altText: Three men sit on a couch with blue wall paper behind them

props.synopsis: Streaming may have increased distribution opportunities for emerging filmmakers, but with limited box office opportunities, is rags-to-riches-success a thing of the past?Â

title.children: Will streaming put an end to surprise indie hits at the box office?

image.altText: Bob Katter smiling in his office.

props.synopsis: Herding Bob Katter is not an easy task for his long-suffering but loyal staff, who battle to keep him on message. But when he wanders, it can turn into viral gold.

title.children: Bob Katter's never lost for words, but there's one topic that's off limits

image.altText: albanese dutton split

props.synopsis: On opposite sides of the nation and of politics, rivals for the same job found themselves echoing familiar pitches, from housing to tax tweaks.

title.children: Labor not counting its chickens as Howard urges Dutton to 'bring home the bacon'

image.altText: A composite image of a Monique Ryan poster and an Amelia Hamer poster.

props.synopsis: While some Kooyong voters in Melbourne's east say teal independent Monique Ryan has performed well, others say they have not seen much change, as the Liberals seek to win back the formerly blue-ribbon seat.

title.children: In Melbourne's leafy east, two candidates fight for a key seat

image.altText: Golfer Rory McIlroy laughs as he strides towards the green during The Masters at Augusta National.

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy looks to protect his two-shot lead over Bryson DeChambeau in the final round of the Masters at Augusta National. Follow all the action live.

title.children: Rose making late charge as Rory rides his luck at Augusta National

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rose moves to within three with a birdie on the 15th

image.altText: Oscar Piastri with the Bahrain Grand Prix winner's trophy

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has driven a flawless race from pole position to win the Bahrain Grand Prix, his second win this Formula 1 season.

title.children: Piastri triumphs in the desert to win F1 Bahrain Grand Prix

image.altText: A female toddler with blonde hair sits on the lap of her mother, who is sitting by a garden

props.synopsis: A decade from now, I don't want to be explaining to my daughters why we've still failed to make progress on gynaecological cancers, writes Elise Worthington.

title.children: This cancer killed my mum and could come for my daughters and me

image.altText: An older man and lady smiling looking at the camera

props.synopsis: John Green was an ABC reporter for 10 years and never thought he'd end up living on the streets. A mental health episode led to a decade sleeping rough.

title.children: Free camping grounds a haven for 'more people than ever' sleeping rough

image.altText: two men facing one another on a dark background one is red and one is blue

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are vying for your vote. Hereâs what sets them apart.

title.children: They're two of the most powerful men in Australia, but who are they really?

image.altText: A man wearing glasses with his hand up giving a speech in front of US flag

props.synopsis: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro and his family are evacuated from their home in the middle of the night after an arsonist set fire to the residence, according to police.Â

title.children: Arsonists set fire to home of Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, police say

image.altText: A table of real guns and gel blasters demonstrates how difficult it is to tell the difference.

props.synopsis: Gel blasters look identical to handguns, shotguns and rifles, making it hard even for officers to tell the difference between a toy and a real gun. Â

title.children: Six people wielding gel blasters shot by Queensland police

image.altText: A drone photo overlooking the Tanami mine, you can see a big pit with infrastructure in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the country's most remote mines is getting a billion-dollar upgrade, taking gold production deeper into the Tanami Desert as gold prices hit record highs.

title.children: Tanami Desert mine to build Australia's deepest gold shaft

image.altText: MVDP is hit by a bidon

props.synopsis: Mathieu van der Poel accuses a fan of "attempted manslaughter" after a full bottle of water hit him in the face during the closing stages of the Paris-Roubaix cycling classic.Â

title.children: Fan accused of 'attempted manslaughter' after throwing water bottle at cyclist

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers during the high jump competition at the national championships.

props.synopsis: Two-time Olympic silver medallist Nicola Olyslagers throws caution to the wind in attempting to break her national high jump record at the Australian Athletics Championships in Perth.

title.children: Olyslagers adopts 'bold' approach to claim sixth national high jump title

image.altText: TikTok post about penjamin chap stick products.

props.synopsis: They can look just like a pen that actually works, lip gloss, a car key or an airpod case. They're called penjamins â disguised to look like everyday objects, allowing the user to vape cannabis discreetly.

title.children: Concerns over cannabis vapes disguised as pens, lip balm, even airpod cases

image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: A South Australian nurse has been reprimanded by South Australia's Civil and Administrative Tribunal after admitting to fabricating documents in a bid to gain employment.

title.children: SA nurse banned after committing 'serious' professional misconduct

image.altText: Two grain silos collapsed with grain pouring into the Shoalhaven River

props.synopsis: Workers at a plant where two silos collapsed last year are at risk of serious injury or death, according to dozens of improvement notices issued by the NSW safety regulator. Â

title.children: SafeWork finds dozens of safety breaches at plant where silos collapsed

image.altText: A man in high-vis standing on an outback landscape, where debris sits by stagnant floodwaters.

props.synopsis: With an upstream gauge out of action, Thargomindah had no way of knowing how much destruction a torrent of floodwaters would have on the outback community. One local, who witnessed the levee break, says that's not good enough.

title.children: To rebuild or walk away? Outback town's heartbreaking flood recovery

image.altText: Two people in orange uniforms walk along a 1.5-metre high wall covered with tarp and along the bottom sand bags.

props.synopsis: With a floodwater levee wrapped around their town, residents in the remote South Australian community of Innamincka say they are stocked up and ready for weeks in isolation.Â

title.children: Locals prepared as floodwaters isolate remote SA township

image.altText: A teenage boy drawing on a paper and drinking juice

props.synopsis: An autistic and non-verbal teenage boy who was shot repeatedly by Idaho police has died after being removed from life support, his family says.

title.children: Teen with autism shot by Idaho police has died, his family confirms

image.altText: An older man and a younger woman look offscreen at something

props.synopsis: Star-studded satirical horror Death of a Unicorn is a refreshingly unique offering in a sea of remakes and reboots.

title.children: Killer unicorns offer a fresh take on the 'eat the rich' satire
